Reviews.Title: “Central, very noisy, average”
Reviews.Author: EdoardoJames
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the hotel for business travel and needed something near Termini station. The hotel dors not have a lobby on the street and is on the 1st floor. I don't appreciate that, honestly. The room was average, some furnishings were well past their replacement age (ancient tv!!!) but the most uncomfortable issue was the noise, which did not come from the abundant traffic: it was all down to a non-carpeted corridor (noisy with heels and trolleys) , chatty staff at 5 AM in the morning and a mix & match of early cleaning lady noise for empty room. The doors do not insulate for noise at all and a neon lam in the room blinked when turned off. Breakfast is average,ok if you like everything with too Much sugar. I did not rest at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: jane h
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have recently spent 3 nights at the Giolli Hotel and have to say that the hotel is positioned in a perfect location within walking distance to all the main attractions-even the Vatican City if you enjoy a longer stroll.There is a great hop on-off city tour bus available to break up the trips.The reception staff were all friendly and helpful and we had a lovely room overlooking the main street. It was spottlessly clean and well equipped even with a mini fridge and hairdryer.The breakfast buffet was adequate to get the day started bearing in mind that is a continental breakfast and not the 'full English', and the food was fresh.The hotel is just a ten minute walk from the train terminal so you do not need to get a taxi to get to it-as long as you have wheeled luggage!All in all we had a fantastic stay and would happily stay here again.Thanks to all at Giolli

Reviews.Title: “Giolli Hotel is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: sflindad
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at Giolli Hotel and it is like a return to visit my Italian family. The staff, especially Carlo are welcoming and happy to make my visit all it can be. Located on Via Nazionale it is a walkable distance from the train station, and 7 minutes at most, by taxi. Rooms are clean, generous and some have larger bathrooms due to their location. Above the 4th floor are private apartments, so I request a 2nd floor to minimize possible noise from 'family time.' Rooms are equipped with a desk, a free safe and there is stocked refrigerators charging reasonable prices for water, wine and snacks. Giolli is rated 3-star and its rates are very reasonable, especially for the city of Rome. Breakfasts include juices, hard-cooked eggs, fresh croissants, rolls, tarts, cheese and Italian cold cuts. There is a barista too, who will serve up your morning cappuccino or espresso. The location of the Giolli couldn't be better to visit all of the historical sites Rome offers. From the front of the building you can see the Vittorio Emmanuel 'wedding cake' building and it is a short walk to it and all of Rome's historic sites. To visit the Trevi Fountain, so you can toss in your coins & return, you just cross the street (Via Milano) and walk through the tunnel, take a left and you're there. Across from the hotel is the Exposition building which offers changing exhibitions, including free photographic exhibits, a cafe and great book and gift store. A taxi stand is directly across from the hotel and in the blocks nearby are several good trattorias and restaurants. Several buses run down Via Nazionale and with the bus signs that list all of the stops, you can't get lost unless you want to! Flying back to the West Coast USA means a hideously early airport departure. But to let you know how thoughtful the staff is, a breakfast is set up for me to eat before my car arrives to take me home. Reading some of the reviews that mention some problems, I'd would like you to give the Giolli Hotel another visit and you'll find, as I did, that the staff are really warm and professional. I am already looking forward to my next visit when again I'll stay at the Giolli Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Jo_John_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a five night stay at the Giolli. We were celebrating our 29th Wedding Anniversary in Rome. We had booked our trip through Airmiles, but after booking we attempted to upgrade our room through the Giolli from a standard room. Unfortunatley this was not possible but we were very kindly presented with a bottle of sparkling wine on our arrival by way of apology. We were initially disappointed with our standard room as it was very small and the view, as described in previous reviews, was onto an outside space and other windows. But the room was spotlessly clean and in reality how much time do you want to spend in your hotel room when you have Rome on the doorstep! And quite literally there was so much on the Giolli's doorstep. Fantastic central location which made it very easy to get around and see all of the sights - make sure that you have comfy shoes! So many lovely restaurants very close to the hotel. Highly recommend the pizzeria Ricci - Est Est Est - just round the corner! The Giolli's breakfast was fairly basic but certainly adequate enough to kick start your day. The staff were all very efficient but not overly friendly.....we certainly weren't greeted with friendly smiley faces at any point but we were happy to settle for answers to any queries that we had and we certainly got this. The proof of a hotel doing all that is required of it is if you would return and the answer to that is yes. It's all about being realistic, it is a 3 star hotel in the centre of a beautiful city and it delivers all that is required of it for it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine F
Reviews.Content: My husband, my two sons and I stayed at Giolli hotel during January 2012. The Giolli is situated in the historical centre of rome, few minutes walk from rome's major historical sites such as the colosseum, trevi fountain etc. The staff has been kind and welcoming, especially Mrs. Silvana which was always there to help us out giving us advice on where to go and what to do. The breakfast itself is normal but what makes it very pleasurable is where it'served: in a big hall right in front of the 'palazo dele esposizioni' (exhibition hall). The rooms are fairly spacious, my husband and I had double room facing via Nazionale while my two sons slept in a smaller twin room facing internally (not as nice but certainly more quite). The giolli was a very good choice and we certainly are going to go back in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT DO IT.”
Reviews.Author: Sanan H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our honeymoon and we check to this hotel Giolli in Roma Italy. Right as we check into the room it was just horrific the toilet seat is under the sink, the heat did not work as it was 12 degrees outside. As I walked into the shower the hot water was just freezing and could not get the hot water to work. After that whole mess I then decided to call the front desk and ask to change rooms, and they actually did. As we checked into the other room it turns out to be even worse their was no room for my wife and I to even get through as we walked around the room and the walls were dirty and scratched up. The front desk clerks knew nothing about the area except for one gentlemen that I forget his name. At one point we almost missed a tour because the front desk clerk didn't even know what was going on, luckily the cab driver knew where to take us and made it on time for our tour. on top of all this mess this so called hotel demands a tax pay after check out it was (2 euros per person per night) I wouldn't mind paying this only if it was a better experiences at this facility. The only thing that actually saved this place was their breakfast at least it compensated for the terrible experience. I don't like to write bad reviews about anything or place, but we were on our honeymoon and this hotel almost ruined our trip. I don't recommend this place at all had I known I would of paid a little more and stayed at a much better hotel again this was our honeymoon trip almost ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation & so central”
Reviews.Author: SurferGirl08
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at Giolli and found the service & position of this hotel in Rome "excellent". The Continental Breakfast was more than your average breakfast. Rooms serviced and soooo clean. As the hotel was very central we walked everywhere..even to The Vatican City (and we are over 60) Our flight arrived very early so when we arrived the concierge had a room for us straight away. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Hussam F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Giolli Hotel for 5 days and it was amazing! Close to the center, affordable prices, great breakfast, clean and nice rooms, and very nice staff! I highly recommend tourists to stay in it. Me and my friends are very satisfied about Goilli Hotel. I'll definitely stay here when I bring my girlfriend next summer!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice,clean hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Maarit54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Hotel Giolli and all in all we found this hotel to be an excellent choise. Although breakfast was very basic and beds a bit hard. Service was excellent,room clean and spacious(we had a triple room) and location superb, all in walking distance. There was bus stop and taxi just in front of the hotel.Good value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “great roman hospitality”
Reviews.Author: dalila s
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week of holiday in rome where I stayed at Hotel Giolli with my boy friend. I rated this hotel 5 out of 5 under every aspect since our stay was just superb. I was surprised at some negative reviews when I consulted this website before my stay at Giolli hotel. The location is simply the best you can get in rome, on a major shopping area!!!! and a few minutes walk from metro, train station, colosseum and other monuments. Getting around rome isn't a problem if you're staying at giolli hotel.. Our room had a street view with balcony, fairly spacious and very clean. Breakfast was varied and of good quality but what me and my boy friend appreciated the most was the cordiality of the staff at Giolli. Every single receptionist was friendly and caring :) I recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a high quality hotel in the centre of rome, i just left the reception door and found myself surrounded by this beautifl city without having to pay for a taxi to get to the centre!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Convenient, Spacious, Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea T
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giolli was a gem! We really wanted an affordable hotel that would allow us to walk to all the major sites, and decided on Hotel Giolli. Little did we know what a great decision that would be. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. We had been in hotels in France and England and understood that European rooms were extremely small. Not the case with Hotel Giolli. Our room was spacious...neither my mom nor I felt cramped at all. Provided a blowdryer (a must for 2 women!). Had a nice breakfast spread of pastries, crackers, warm drinks and juices. Would recommend to everyone! Only about a 10 min walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain, maybe 20 minutes from the Colosseum and Forum.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleDazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights last week. A really nice room and comfortable beds. By far the biggest room and bathroom we had on our 2 weeks in Italy. Staff were fine, breakfast was good ( Italian breakfasts tend to be a bit minimal ) and the location couldn't be faulted. Just about a 10 minute walk to anywhere apart from the Vatican. Would definitely stay there if in Rome again. Not bad value at 140 Euro a night in peak season as well.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Mizlinay
Reviews.Content: It is amazing to see the difference in reviews which makes me wonder if much is in the expectation. We were not looking for American-style amenities or we would have stayed at one of the chain hotels. We wanted to see Rome, to be centrally located, safe and comfortable and be able to get suggestions and directions when needed. We found Giolli to provide for all of these priorities. It was charming and clean. The building is in keeping with the lovely antiquity of Rome and has been renovated with care, losing none of the charm of it's history. Our room was tiny and had no view, but we were not concerned with this as we were out and about the entire 3 days of our stay, as most sites were easily in walking distance. Resources such as buses, taxis, and even a tourist information site were right outside the hotel. Giolli is set in a hub of activity, on a main street with shopping and restaurants. This may not be to the liking of some travelers, but it suited us just fine. The staff was ready and willing to help. As far as breakfast went, it was very good with cheeses, meats, eggs, fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt and an assortment of breads and pastries. In fact theirs was the best coffee we had during the two weeks we spent in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dean S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights of our 5 week visit to Italy and found it to be the worst hotel we stayed at. The room had 2 single beds pushed together and a double matress placed over the top, which made for a very uncomfortable bed. The air conditioning barely worked and as the outside temperatures were in the high 30s this made sleeping difficult. The toilet ran constantly and it took the staff 2 days to repair. On the positive side, the location is fine and one of the 3 reception staff was helpful and possesed some personality.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Rashid M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Via Nazionale and is close to the Roma Termini station and major attractions of the city - Colloseum, spanish steps, Trevi fountain etc., which are all within walking distance. Even otherwise the bus stop where buses going to the tourist spots is bang opposite the hotel. Lots of food joints in and around the neighborhood. Coming to the comforts of the hotel there is nothing much to write about. Rooms are small and the one we had was without a view. Air conditioning was barely functioning. Breakfast was meager at best. Staff were polite but helpful only on request. There is no need to depend on the high cost transport provided by the hotel as the taxi (Euro 40 fixed) or the Metro/bus system is quite fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Breakfast disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: JayneyMcIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days last week. Had read reviews and knew what to expect. The hotel is basic and decent in terms of facilities. However its the location that made this hotel so convenient. We were able to walk to all the cities main attractions and it was also on the bus route, so when our feet were tired and the sun was hot, having the bus come along every so often was great. Lots of reasturants around and few good irish pubs in the locality. Ristorante Stregga was one of our favourites in Rome, just off nazionale beside the fountain of remus and romulus. The rooms were big and so was the bathroom and both were clean. The shower was not good at all though, no power and often cold. But the hand handheld one in the bath worked well and was also handy too. After a long day walking in rome, the beds were very comfortable and we fell asleep easily. Wifi was available but for a surcharge of one euro per hour. Being honest the biggest disappointment for this hotel was its breakfast. I have been in many hotels were continental breakfast is served and this was certainly one of the worst ive experienced. Very limited choice, poor coffee facilities and no fresh fruit. Italian practice is continental but this was not a good effort in comparison to other italian hotels ive stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT! AMAZING STAY!! MEMORABLE”
Reviews.Author: aliciabarb
Reviews.Content: First of all what i liked the most was the kindness i received, as soon as i arrived, from the receptionists. Very friendly, kind and not at all "intrusive". Our room was located on the second floor where we had a nice window with a wonderful view of the major street the hotel is located in. In fact the street where the hotel is located (which if i remember correctly is called "via nazionale") joins two very popular squares in the city. Breakfast was good, the hotel was VERY clean and convenient. why convenient? first of all because of the price and secondly due to the bus station, taxi station and tourist office just accross the street. what more could a tourist want?! i thank my travel agency for suggesting me and my friends Hotel Giolli and i also thanks all the staff working there! THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: farah06
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Giolli for a week at the beginning of May. We were pleased with the staff since the first second we arrived as they were all friendly and welcoming. My father lost his luggage in the airport of Rome and the receptionist did everything he could so he could get it back. By the end of our first day in Rome our problem was sorted. The hotel is also located in the heart of Rome's historical centre meaning that most of the tourist attractions are within 10 minute walk from the hotel.Moreover the rooms are clean and equipped with additional services.Our stay at Hotel Giolli was very good, perfect value to our money has been given and we will certainly go back for Christmas.I strongly recommend Hotel Giolli

Reviews.Title: “superb holiday retreat”
Reviews.Author: guanda07
Reviews.Content: The facilicites for this hotel was incredbile, the breakfast to start the day was delightful, plate upon plate of continetal breakfast was well suited for the location and started the day nicely, after having a horrible day at the airport where we lost our luggage Mr gianni was very helpful and managed to locate our luggage for us within the following day which was of great help meaning we could have a proper holiday being able to relax in the town in local bars very close to the hotel which seems to be perfectly located in the centre of Rome. Just infront of the hotel there is stationed a taxi rank, bus station and tourist information office which was of great help for when we wanted to go on excurcions during the day within Rome and just to see the surrounding areas. All in all the rooms were very nice, with a ensuit which was very nice and well proportioned accoriding to our room along with a good wifi connection meaning i could talk to my family on skype most days. After the first two days i recognised the fantastic view from the window showing the "palaso del Esposizioni" only certifing in my mind that this room was undoubtedly worth every cent. I would definately reccomend this hotel for a picturesque visit to Rome with a well locationed room and thank you again to Mr Gianni.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Trudi5093
Reviews.Content: We would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It has a wonderful location, you can walk to virtually everything and it has a great choice of places to eat and shop locally. The rooms are small but comfortable and the a/c in very effective. The staff are lovely, very helpful and informative and the breakfast buffet was more than adequate. We loved Rome and would recommend this hotel to anyone, for a city break it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Catherine C
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this is not a negative review of Gioli just a very honest one. This hotel is ideally located for easy walking distance to all of Rome's best attractions - we even walked to the Vatican from here! However you can pretty much expect to get what you pay for. It has 3 stars for a reason, its average and thats precisely what you get. The rooms are very small, the bed mattresses are very firm and the view (if you're at the back as we were) are of another building just a few metres away, in fact as we were on the first floor the towering building in front of the window didnt actually allow us to see whether it was a sunny day or not so you end up waking up thinking that its still dark or overcast! Our a/c unit didnt work very well, we did mention it to reception but didnt get any assurance as to whether someone was going to look at it so as a result with the Roman weather it was quite stuffy at night. Our safe was also broken so we had to leave valuables inside a locked suitcase. It also has the tiniest lift (elevator) you have ever seen which kind of added to its quirkiness but probably not so good if you suffer from claustraphobia! It was however very clean, lots of running water, a good housekeeping service and breakfast (self service continental) was adequate for a day's worth of sightseeing. Reception handed out a free map for us with details of the best attractions to visit and we used this map throughout our whole stay as it was very handy. Its best to use this hotel as a crash pad with the assurance that you're centrally located with some nice little shops and restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Bad.”
Reviews.Author: TppT
Reviews.Content: This was one the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms were dark, have not been refurbished for decades and bear ABSOLUTELY no resemblance to what is shown on the website. I was not at all impressed by the cleanliness of the room (the towels were stained, the bathtub was dirty, and the showerhead looked disgusting). The A/C was so noisy that I had to switch it off. Breakfast did not look at all appealing (I had a look at it, and chose to eat elsewhere). The only good thing going for this hotel really is its location, and that what you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Enough - And Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ejavila
Reviews.Content: Definitely agree with all who noted this hotel as having a great location. A 10 minute walk to the Colisseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, great shops, and great restaurants. I think anyone expecting a posh or great room will be disappointed; however, if you're looking for a comfortable place to rest your weary feet at the end of the day, Hotel Giolli more than suffices. We had a triple room (one double bed, one single) that while not huge, was far from small. We were comfortable enough with three of us in the room for three nights. We also lucked out with one of the two balconies and that in and of itself made the room a pretty awesome choice for us. Breakfast was fine. Nothing exceptional, but definitely good enough to get a nice fill before heading out for the day. The Front Desk was exceptional. Each person we had was very helpful in anything from checking us in/out, to providing restaurant recommendations (the best food I had the entire trip was at a less-expensive recommendation by the front desk), to offering amenities (such as a fan) when we requested. Only complaint...our room was WARM. We discovered this would be more then norm when traveling through Europe, so I can't hold it against this specific hotel, but be forewarned, it was toasty. Regardless, Rome was awesome and the people amazing. The hotel did zero to detract from that and only added to the enjoyment of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central but cramped”
Reviews.Author: ballyjamesduff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a building shared with another hotel and business. The big plus is its location - convenient to all the sites. The rooms are clean but range in size from small to very small. Given the cost, I'm not sure if its value for money but certainly convenient to attractions for all but the slightly claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, European rooms”
Reviews.Author: Moved2Texas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giolli on Via Nazionale in Rome is a nice 3-star hotel. The rooms are typical european, with private baths and small rooms. We were in a king single bed room. The shower/bathtub was clean and the room was fine. The hotel had a nice breakfast room on the second floor which doubled as a bar in the evenings. Wireless internet was available for a fee and you could purchase as little as one hour for a Euro, which could be used in increments for up to 48 hours. I liked that because I just needed to get on the internet for short periods to pull down e-mail and could then get off - much less than most american hotels charge where it isn't free. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the free continental breakfast was more than adequate. In addition to breads, pastries and cereal, it had peach halves, as well as cheese, ham or another meat and hard boiled eggs. Cappucino could be made on request. The hotel had a very small elevator - about 2.5 feet deep by about 4 feet wide - just enough for several bags and perhaps two thin people! Not good if you are in a wheelchair be perfectly adequate for the rest of us. It was kind of fun! Best feature is location - it is a short walk (15 minutes) to the Trevi Fountain in one direction and the Coliseum and Forum in the other direction. There are some nice quiet restaurants on side streets nearby, and some nice shopping opportunities, although not very highbrow. We would go back and were perfectly happy in the room, but it is much smaller than typical American hotels. So be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “excelent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelw80
Reviews.Content: we stayed four nights in Hotel Giolli (march 2011) ,had a wonderful time, excellent location, good basic breakfast, clean and comfort room, familiar & helpful staff. rachel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SR32
Reviews.Content: Giolli Hotel is situated on the first floor of an old mansion. Service was absolutely outstanding. Accommodation, although basic, was more than adequately comfortable. Breakfast was pretty basic (yogurts, cereal, coffee, donuts, fruit). For the low price this hotel charges and the perfect location it offer - you really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: DarbyDoolittle
Reviews.Content: Giolli is an easy 15 minute walk from the train station, and centrally located to the Colleseum, Trevi Fountain, etc. Our hotel room was large, clean, comfortable and quiet (except for a few minutes when some business men returned a bit late and spoke very LOUDLY down the hall to each other). Breakfast is included, with a wide array of cold items. No hot breakfast, but with fruit, yogurt, cold cuts and chocolate croissants, we were happy. Carlo, our evening desk clerk, really made our Rome stay fantastic. Not only is he delightful and friendly, he gave great suggestions for reasonably priced restaurants (with courtesy welcome drink coupons) and great suggestions for a Pompeii tour and how best to get to the Vatican (subway). He helped cultivate my primitive Italian, and compared it to Spanish, which I can speak. Carlo is a definite 10. Carlo warned us about pickpockets in crowded areas, especially on public transit. Nevertheless, my husband and I got separated by the crowd getting on the Metro. We were both on high alert, keeping our wallets in front packs, with our hands on the zippers. My husband ignored the distraction of someone tapping him on the shoulder a couple of times, but was blocked exiting. One guy blocked the door, holding the handrail, forcing him to squeeze through. On the platform, my husband's front pack zippers were unzipped about 2", up to where his hand was. Nothing was taken from the pack, but someone did pickpocket his front jeans pocket. He never felt it. The good news is that the thieving dogs only got a free city map. Carlo gave us a fresh one that evening.

Reviews.Title: “Will you pay over 100euros a night for a student's hostel?”
Reviews.Author: Buddhakkan
Reviews.Content: Location: I think that is the only thing that works for this hotel but then at over 120 euros that’s the least you expect. The hotel is in an old building, the room I stayed in opened to a wall, so the lights had to be on 24 hours. The building has one small lift, which can fit in only one adult with one suitcase, if you have more too bad make more trips. I had a single room; it was smaller than my hostel room and looked very similar in terms of furnishings. Breakfast is very basic. there is no service in the evening. The hotel only has a cafe so you have to go out for all meals. My question is if you want a student’s hostel will you pay 120 euros a night for it? There is no one to help with the luggage even if you are a sole woman traveler. The staff speaks English but you have to talk very slowly. The staff is not friendly, which is very unlike Italians, but they are not rude. Internet was good and the person at the reception was kind enough to tell me that I should only book for 6 hours instead for my whole stay as I will be most of the time out of the hotel. Locationwise, the hotel is well placed- you can walk everywhere and can take a bus to the Vatican, but then most hotels in central Rome has this quality… and now that I have walked around the place, I can think of atleast 20 other options which definitely looked better than this hotel. I am going back to Rome in the summer with my family, I do not think I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... can walk anywhere from here”
Reviews.Author: missgc
Reviews.Content: We couldnt fault the Hotel Giolli. Every tourist attraction was within easy walking distance from this hotel. Our room was spacious and the bathroom huge. Air conditioning worked perfectly. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but the hotel is an optical illusion!”
Reviews.Author: ICOGNIT0
Reviews.Content: The hotel was at a very good condition but the air condition insufficient to cool down the room. WiFi internet not working sometimes in the room. We had problem with the shower it took them almost three days to fix it. For the breakfast you have to wake up early otherwise some of the stuff from the menu is not available at the buffet then. Location is great for sight seeing. The reception desk was not helpful with fixing the problems at the hotel. They send some guy to fix the shower and he did not speak English at all. For that price range I would not recommend the hotel to other persons visiting Rome. I would call it as an optical illusion since it looks nice but its not that comfortable. We booked a double room with double bed, they provided us a twin bed and promissed to replace it but did not do that at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Satisfying Stay”
Reviews.Author: Unforth
Reviews.Content: Just finished my stay at this hotel yesterday, and I was very satisfied. Breakfast was unexpectedly included, we got upgraded to a triple because because all the doubles were booked, and the staff were helpful, if often a little bit distracted and busy. The breakfast was small but adequate, and the room was small, but I had expected that, as I was warned that many hotels in Italy have small rooms. A few things took some getting used to - regulating the air conditioner, for example, and the fact that we had to turn our key in whenever we left (otherwise the staff couldn't have gotten in, as each room only had one key). However, over all it was a very pleasant stay - great location for getting pretty much everywhere. The only negative was that our bathroom smelled a bit like sewage, so we always kept the bathroom door closed - when closed, it wasn't noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good three star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJP_5
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in Hotel Giolli at the start of August. We had two rooms one for ourselves and one for our two boys 15 &11. The Hotel put us both on the same floor as requested, and immediately changed the beds from double to twin for the boys. The price was excellent and the hotel is easily 3 stars. The two rooms were slightly different sizes, our room was a bit bigger than the boys, but both were reasonably sized. Breakfast was very good - didn't try the coffee from the pots but you can request fresh cappuccino which was lovely. The air-conditioning worked extremely well in our rooms. Hotel was in the middle of upgrading their wi-fi whilst we were there so there wasn't any for a few days, but they were very kind and allowed us to use a wired connection in the lounge in the evening. We had some problems with our laptop settings and two kind hotel employees (sorry don't know their names) spent a lot of time trying to help us - thank you it worked eventually. The positioning of the hotel is excellent. We walked from here to Vatican and all the sites, the Colosseum is just around the corner and if you get tired there is a metro station at the top of the road which we used to get back after a full day's walking. The restaurant around the corner was also an excellent recommendation by Carlos. Best bits - location, breakfast, decent clean rooms. Worst - VERY minor but batteries ran out in air-conditioner remote, we went and bought some from shop up the road as the person manning the desk didn't know where they were kept (as we arrived back we were offered new ones, so it really wasn't a big deal).

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: DianneMargaret
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well situated - an easy walk from the station (but not too close) & bus and taxi transport at the door. Most tourist sights were with easy distance. My room was clean and the bathroom was roomy and included a bath as well as a shower. The breakfast was fresh with a wide choice of foods. There was a comfortable lounge area with TV. The two different people I dealt with at reception were off handed and not approachable but I thought the hotel was comfortable and offered good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MargieMom_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Giolli for 5 nights and found it to be comfortable, although very small rooms. We do know, however, that European hotel rooms are much smaller than in the U.S... Our room and bathroom were always very clean and we had wi-fi in our room. They could have had a better breakfast selection and the coffee was TERRIBLE. We always got a chuckle when riding that elevator up to our floor. Regarding the A/C situation another traveler wrote about: The room key is the "remote" for the A/C. When you enter the room, you insert the room key card into a slot and the A/C comes on. It never got cold, but ours was adequate. The hotel was very quiet and in a perfect location. Lots of sights within walking distance and good restaurants, also. We also found Carlos to be most helpful and friendly, but other staff were not so friendly. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Giolli for the location and price (150 per night for triple).

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Rndthewrld
Reviews.Content: It took us at least an hour of driving around the historic area to find the hotel. The location is easy to find but we made some wrong turns and got stuck on some narrow one-way streets. We called the gentleman at the front desk of Hotel Giolli and he was very patient and helpful. I stayed here with my mother, aunt and cousin for 4 nights. My mother and I shared room 306 which had two twin beds. The beds were comfortable, the air conditioning worked well and the bathroom was clean. There was a full tub with a shower head, but, as with most 3 stars in Italy, no shower curtain. Our safe had dead batteries when we arrived but they were replaced before we returned from dinner that night. I was glad that it fit my 13" laptop. The internet access in the lobby came and went but was free. The breakfast was standard Italian light breakfast with pastries, yogurt, fruit, cappuccino and hard boiled eggs. We were only a few minutes walk to the Repubblica metro stop and just a little farther to the main terminal station. We found the metro very easy to use and affordable. Just before you get to the Repubblica stop walking from the hotel there is a news stand that sells metro and bus tickets. The walk to Trevi fountain was about 10 minutes. The evening concierge recommended a restaurant two blocks away and gave us a coupon for it. The food was great and the service even better. We ate here 2 nights. The building feels nice and secure. There are security guards in a booth as you head up the stairs and he exterior door is closed after 10pm. There is a call button and they buzz you in.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: barnloves2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 days - the rooms are great - very big - as well as the bathrooms. Best location - walking distance to most of the sites. A 5 minute walk to the train station and metro. Good restaurants close as well as reasonable shopping. The staff was very helpful - great suggestions for the restaurants - good work Carlos!!. The price is not cheap - we were able to negotiate our rate down a bit - it averaged out to 150 per night - considering the location and the quality of the place - well worth it. Wifi available and included in price of room as well as breakfast. Wifi only available in breakfast room. Breakfast was ok -- basic cold hard boiled eggs and fresh pastries. Coffee not so great though.

Reviews.Title: “Saving Grace was Carlo - otherwise wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: conversation
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at the Giolli before traveling on to Tuscany. The gentleman who works the front desk during the day (until 3) did not greet us, did not smile and was generally extremely unpleasant and unfriendly. This week was a week of 85-90 degree temperatures and the remote for the air conditioner was not in the room. When we requested it, this man at the front desk argued with us and told us that it was central air and he couldn't give us a remote for our room. We persisted for 10 minutes and he agreed to call someone to find a remote. After waiting 30 minutes, we went back to the front desk and asked a young woman if she could assist us. She did and we finally got a remote so we could use the AC. Unfortunately, it was very weak and did not cool the room adequately. We could not sleep. Next, our room was not cleaned - when we returned to our room at 3:30 p.m. we asked if anyone would be cleaning it and we were told it should have already been done. We told them it wasn't and they said they would have it done immediately. We left again and returned at 8:00 p.m. to find that it still hadn't been cleaned. Carlo at the front desk had one of the housekeepers clean it immediately, offered us a free cocktail and sent us a bowl of fresh fruit ,which was very thoughtful. The next day when the housekeeper came to clean the room we were still there and asked her to clean it "pui tarde" which I believe means "later." Again, we returned that evening to find it had not been cleaned. We returned to the Giolli for one night after our Tuscany visit. We had hoped to book a different hotel after our awful experience the first 4 days but were unable to do so. We were again met by the unpleasant, rude front desk employee. He did not even say good morning, hello, welcome back - nothing. We were given a much larger room (which we later learned was due to Carlo marking our reservation as VIP). While we were checking in we asked if the remote for the air conditioning was in the room. We were told it was. We asked again and also asked if it was working and we were told it was. We went to the room to find that there was no remote for the AC. We went back to the front desk and again asked for the AC remote. We waited 30 minutes and were finally given the remote. It was worse than the previous room and did not cool the room at all. We were awake the entire night. The elevator is so small that we could only fit the luggage and one of us in it. The room smelled like cigarette smoke and the beds were hard and uncomfortable. However, the rooms were clean, the breakfast was adequate and the hotel is in a great location. I would rate the hotel as a 2 star, not a 3 star. Then, there's Carlo. He is pleasant, thoughtful, knowledgeable, and extremely helpful. He should be working at a much better hotel where his talents would be appreciated. He made excellent restaurant recommendations and generally treated us with respect and kindness. If it weren't for him our Rome visit would not have been as pleasant as it was. We definitely will not return to this hotel and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place but unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Maguss22
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on my own so I thought the single room they gave me was fairly sizeable and decent sized bathroom. Hotel is in a good location and clean but aircon didn't seem to work was very warm at night. However I found the staff on reception not very helpful, maybe they are overworked but they all seemed very on edge and annoyed when I asked them simple questions. My second night there I arrived home late so I asked for a good place to eat nearby as I didn't want to venture far, there was no one else at reception but the guy still practically took my head off. The same again when I asked another question of a different guy a few days later. Its a grand hotel but was a bit turned off by this. There is nothing this special about this place though so I wouldn't be rushing to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is superb. Location and...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb. Location and facilities are excellent. Staff are friendly and helpful. I was staying at a 4 star before this hotel and this was infinately. Cannot recommend this highly enough. Will stay here again and have told all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: CharmaineGloucester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Giolli for a week in July last year, Reception, lounge and Bar are very presentable, nice furnishings ect, The guy on reception was quite friendly and checked us in without any problems, The room itself wasnt too bad but looked nothing like the ones on the website, also the room was a bit dark, air con diddnt work to well either and with the heat of July it wasnt great, but it was clean and housekeeping left clean towels everyday , breakfast was what you would expect in rome, coffee and pastries mainly, I wouldnt say this hotel is luxury but is in a good location ( plenty of restaurants around and within walking distance to major attractions) and clean and basic.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: chebba
Reviews.Content: Trip of a lifetime and this hotel was an integral part in making the memories. Perfectly situated in the heart of Rome with all the points of interest easily accessible by transport. The staff and management at Hotel Giolli were extremely friendly, informative and more than accommodating to meet our needs. A wonderful breakfast got us started every day. The rooms were very comfortable and always clean, fresh and bright. A big thankyou to everyone. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to any travellers. We hope to be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “DELIGHTFUL GIOLLI!”
Reviews.Author: mat1965
Reviews.Content: The facilities were very good. The location is excellent-- ideally situated for easy access to all forms of transit (within a block and a half!) The breakfast was great- all kinds of sweet rolls, cheese, yogurt and fabulous coffee. Internet cafe a few doors down, but wi fi service available at hotel if only we had brought our laptop. Staff very accomodating and friendly! Would thorouly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: paupomac
Reviews.Content: Functional, friendly and efficient Roman address for our five day stay last December. We booked at the last minute, not knowing what to expect, and found a delightful welcome in this charmingly situated hotel in the centre of Rome. Friendly, knowledgable staff made our visit to Rome an unforgettable one. Special thanks to Carlos and Annemarie.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay ay, enjoy and come back to.”
Reviews.Author: starall
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Giolli Hotel in Rome. It is perfectly located in the center of the city, walking distance from "Piazza Venezia" and from Rome Termini Train Station, which makes it easy to reach, and from all other major touristic attractions. The staff was really friendly and helpful, which is something that contribute to a nice vacation. I would recommend Giolli Hotel for all of you planning to go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay, Rome is noicy, but this hotel is quite”
Reviews.Author: utomlands
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is comfortable in the center, near to busses and metro. The first night we had a room to the street with traffic, but we could change it into a more calm room. They have a fine breakfast whith youghurt and so on. It´s important to eat well before going on sight-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Efstathios
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in the heart of the city of Rome, walking distance to major attractions, it really represents a perfect starting point for exploring the historic center (Piazza Venezia, Colosseo, Fori Romani, Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Spagna, Piazza Navona, famous Shopping Streets etc.). The room was very comfortable and clean. The staff was extremely friendly, polite and helpful: always able to answer questions and resolve any issues. Good breakfast buffet including Italian pastries. We definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and we are looking forward to coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good work Giolli!”
Reviews.Author: AthensTraveler1971
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the beginning of November 2009 and we were very satisfied. Nice hotel, situated in the 3 first floors of a mansion house with friendly staff, basic/plain breakfast, a comfortable double room, Wi-Fi, small LCD TV and “paper thin walls” (that caused no serious problems though). As mentioned (several times) location is the major plus of this hotel. Located just a walking distance from many of Rome’s great exhibits with some very nice restaurants and cafes nearby. Bus 64 passes in front of the hotel and takes you as far as Vatican City. Overall I would recommend Giolli hotel for anyone who is looking a nice, centered situated, budget hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back, of course :)”
Reviews.Author: adela_catalina
Reviews.Content: Giolli is wonderfully kept and employs some great people. It has a perfect location - 7 minutes to vittorio emanuele and the fori imperiali, another 10 to trevi fountain or the quirinale and a bus station which serves termini in 5 minutes. plus, via nazionale is extremely safe even at small hours The service is very good, and staff are friendly and accommodating, not to say they have a good sense of humor. The rooms vary in size from regular to very spacious, but never cramped. Breakfast is a bit unimaginative though. The building is an old building, large and luminous, perfectly preserved and carefully adapted to modern comforts overall, it's very good and I'll be back next spring

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: leafchick
Reviews.Content: room was clean, bathroom was large -had a bathtub with a shower head as well!!! great location, walking distance to so much... fabulous shopping outside the door, as well as great restaurants on the side streets surrounding the hotel. would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Ladywop
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giolli is in a perfect location within walking distance of all the major locations, in particular the Colosseum, the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon and with excellent bus services outside the door if needed. A tourist information booth is also over the road. My son and I had a twin room on the third floor. The room was small, but comfortable. No views, but air con (needed!!), a free safe, a good sized bathroom and the room, like the rest of the hotel, was clean, with fresh towels every day. Breakfast was sufficient - unlimited bread rolls, pastries, cereals, egg and choice of juices, tea or coffee. A massive choice of bars, restaurants etc close by, particularly those along the side and back streets - great service and value for money. When you spend your days touring this amazing city all you need is a clean, comfortable and reliable place to return to. Hotel Giolli has this.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: kittytravels_27
Reviews.Content: this hotel was overrated, there are other hotels much more central in Rome. the staff was not very helpful, and the rooms smelled like cigarettes and were not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for anyone headed to Rome”
Reviews.Author: chrisnoc
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel at the reservation desk at Rome Fiumicino Airport when we arrived in Rome. I had checked out prices and locations prior to the trip but it was a last-minute deal and we were flying standby so we didn't want to book anything and lose a deposit. We were very pleasantly surprised at our find and the good value price we received especially considering it was Holy Week (week before Easter) in Rome. We had a little trouble locating the street and hotel from the directions we were given but it is a reasonable 10-15 minute walk from Rome Termini train station. We arrived at the hotel around Noon and they were able to let us check in right away. The room was clean and efficient with just enough space for the two of us. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom large and clean. The hotel is very well kept and the reception is on the 2nd floor of the building. There is a tiny 2-person max (typical) lift in the stairwell that will be useful for those on higher floors. We wound up on floor 3 so often it was easier to use the stairs. The hotel desk staff was quite helpful and accomodating to show us locations on maps and recommend sights and restaurants nearby. The breakfast room and sitting lounge is just off the hotel desk on the 2nd floor. The breakfast was a good selection for a usual European continental service with cereal, yogurt, breads, pastries, cold meat and cheese slices and various juices and coffees. They also will serve espresso and capuccinos to order. The breakfast room was often quite busy but we were always able to locate a table right away. The hotel is located midway between Termini station and the Victore Emmanual Monument. Most locations for sightseeing are within a 20-30 minute walking distance and a bus stop for various lines is nearby on the street (Via Nazionale) to take you to Termini or any other location. There are a number of shops and banks along Via Nazionale along with several restaurants located on the street and various side streets up and down the avenue. A pharmacia is only a block or so away and a tourist info center is across the street. Overall I highly recommend the hotel and felt it was a great value. We paid 75euros per night for a twin room for our 3 night stay from Sunday to Wednesday.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Adamantina
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel Giolli on a recommendation from fellow travellers we met in Ischia. It was perfect for what we wanted and needed during our stay in Rome. The gentlemen at the front desk are all very helpful. Gianni and Antonio were very friendly and competent with all our enquiries. Rooms are nicely decorated, very clean, great bathroom, useful in-room safe and excellent breakfast. I enjoyed the wholemeal rye bread and delicious patés! The bed was good, great water pressure in the shower and perfect AC. We felt very safe, well cared for and protected which is an important issue for young ladies travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Rome”
Reviews.Author: tullyb1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giolli is about 10 mins walk from Termini station and convenient for commuting to and from Ciampino airport. Hotel room was a good size with ensuite bathroom with full size bath, Sat TV, mini bar and was warm and clean. Good buffet breakfast choices. Staff were very friendly and gave good advice on where main sites were. Advised by staff not to use no.64 bus if you want to keep your valuables. Most major sites (apart from Vatican) were 10-15 mins walk from hotel. Overall a great centrally located base for our first trip to Rome and I would highly recommend the hotel and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianNapier
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Giolli for two nights. The first night we were given a room that stank of cigarette smoke, so much so, that our clothes/hair smelled like smokers the following morning. We complained to the receptionist and were given a new room, which was smaller, but a lot better furnished. The reception staff were nice and helpful, however the waiter in the breakfast room refused to make me a fresh cup of coffee, telling me to use the jug of coffee on the drinks table. I tried it, and it had obviously been there for hours. He then proceeded to make two seperate Italian guests a fresh cup not five minutes later, right in front of me! Overall, the hotel is well located but needs to up its game. I won't return here in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “From Sweden to Italy.”
Reviews.Author: NABRUUpsala
Reviews.Content: I had been reading a lot on Tripadvisor about different hotels in Rome. We wanted a central position for our daily walking thruogh the City. We, my wife and I, found that Giolli Hotel was on the list from our travel agnency and I have been staying in the same area before so we took Giolli hotel for 4 nights. No problem with room 128, first hotelfloor, the room in the back. A silent room!! Bigger than the others, what we know of. But still expensive if you compere with other Hotels in Rome, Cellini as exempel. But it was alright but NO luxery. Sleeping for the night a bath as simple as that....A TV with a screen small as a computorscreen. The beds hard but not unpleasent. Change of sheets and tovels is OK. But still we could have it better...it will not be a second time on this Hotel. Its a pity that we was in the hands of the Travel Agency and there list of Hotels. Never more I will go through a Agency. I will reading more on Tripadvisor of the first/second degreehotels on the TopTen before I go somewhere!! Do that Yourself so you dont miss the best!

Reviews.Title: “Would pass on the Giolli next time around !”
Reviews.Author: Bergy100
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in Rome, had a lovely trip, but was disappointed by the Hotel. The Reception is on the first floor & you access by a tiny lift. Rooms were compact, boardering on small but acceptable. There was a tiny TV ( about 20 years old) The shower spluttered hot & cold every day( old pipe works I suspect) Breakfast was basic . The best thing about the hotel was the location, its very central & despite the fact that itwas a very basic Hotel, we enjoyed Rome immensely. The weather was great, the sightseeing in Rome was fantastic. We paid €550 for a 3 night stay in the Giolli, which is not cheap, but I would say this is a 2 star hotel.Not a 3 star !. Anyway I dont want to put anyone off, but Rome was superb, would shop around for a nicer hotel next time around Bergy

Reviews.Title: “how unprofessional it is to "show" strictness to guests at the reception.”
Reviews.Author: soleny
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortale and clean,breakfast pretty good,all the staff welcoming and friendly except the older man I had to see often at receptıon .he took my passport,thats Ok,wanted me to do payment every day strictly before the stay still not so bad but hindering my few nice words to be even more serious and asking me the same question everyday made me think what does he look for in this nice hotel?Professionel means make the guest feel at holiday,not try to stick in your eyes how strict they are...While he thinks he is being very professional it is quite unprofessional in tourism business.(Not the thinner nice gentleman, the bigger gentleman)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Giolli!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller052
Reviews.Content: My friend and I treated ourselves to a holiday in Rome and we couldnt have found a better hotel than the Giolli!! The location is excellent, right in the heart of town and a few minutes walk from basically anywhere! The rooms were very comfortable and had everything we needed. And the staff was amazingly welcoming and always at our disposal! For what we could afford the Giolli hotel was absolutely perfect!! We would love to go back and stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Giolli”
Reviews.Author: chrischristie
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip at the last moment and stayed four nights at the Hotel Giolli in Rome. What an outstanding facility! The staff was very courteous, helping with directions for the Metro, bus numbers to various parts of Rome, booking us different resaurants when needed. The hotel is well cared for, comfortable and clean. Rooms have a key card system, plus inroom safe free of charge and cable TV. Locationwise the Hotel Giolli is conveniently located in walking distance to many attractions. There is also a metro stop a few blocks down the street. Our special thanks goes to Gianni who helped us tremondously, making numerous telephone calls to retrieve my son’s knapsack and glasses. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, thats it!”
Reviews.Author: Hilbre-Lady
Reviews.Content: Good location. Grumpy staff except for Carlo who was so very helpful and should be working somewhere worthy of him! If you have already booked to stay you will be ok, but I would pay a touch more for a better hotel. It all depends what your priority is.After long days sightseeing, I enjoy a touch of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giolli”
Reviews.Author: Nannero
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, clean and nice atmosphere. Pretty good breakfast. Good location, near the famous attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Simple; Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: Perfectly simple little place. Very hands-off and simple set up in the room and staff wise. For folks on a budget and wanting something right in the heart of the city right near public transportation food and sites this is a good location. Don't expect anything better than extremely basic, a 2 star hotel that is clean...with no amenities whatsoever, then you will be fine at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out ! Thieves about!”
Reviews.Author: mwandco
Reviews.Content: Please note that we had money stolen from the safe within the bedroom - both were locked as we left and both were locked again upon our return. Key code wouldn't open safe - presumed we'd forgotten numbers but when porter used special key, we found contents disturbed and money missing. Only small amount of money taken - less easy to spot? Passports etc left behind. Hotel management refused to believe and address likelihood of staff pilfering. Who else has access to both locks? (No forced entry) Second group of people reported same the next day whilst they were at breakfast! So watch out if you want to stay there - whoever's taking it, they may get yours as well? Other than that, ideal location, room simple but functional.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly hotel Giolli”
Reviews.Author: SheilaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in very cold November. Rooms were spacious, warm (thank goodness) and very clean, with good bathroom facilities and clean linen. Reception staff, especially Carlo were helpful and assisted me when I left a bag in a taxi. The very honest taxi driver had called the hotel to let them know he had my bag and Carlo arranged with him to return it to me next morning! The only criticism would be that breakfast is fairly basic with a hot water urn for tea which occaisionally was tepid as it had been there a while. Excellent location to get to Colosseum before the crowds, and many other central sights

Reviews.Title: “Great - Wonderful friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbo1963
Reviews.Content: We loved this place-we stayed 3 nights in mid september - easy to find great location very clean - the rooms were spacious enough for two - the staff friendly and helpful - Breakfast was delightful ann served in a lovely room - I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a no nonsense well priced (for Rome) well located stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Giolli”
Reviews.Author: Steampiper
Reviews.Content: Just spent 10 days booked at the Giolli and we enjoyed it very much. We laughed at the "barbie" elevator, but was able to get the two of us and two bags inside LOL Don't expect your room to be ready when you arrive, but once you get settled in, the rooms are clean and safe. Others have said it was noisy, but we were on the first floor and didn't hear anything. Breakfast is rather skimpy, but did suffice. We were able to walk to all the major sights around Rome except for the Vatican City. Take the 64N bus right across the street from the hotel and it drops you right off at the Vatican. Take the 64 bus back to the hotel as well. We became very friendly with the staff, and shared our personal lives with them. Our only complaint was the gentlemen that works the graveyard shift. We were standing outside the hotel ringing the doorbell for 30 minutes before he let us in, which turned out to be 2:15 a.m. Other than that....stay here for the convenience and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “problem with phone bill”
Reviews.Author: gypsy56
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely, clean hotel and the staff where very helpful. The only problem I had is when we went to settle up our bill at the end of our stay they said we had made 7 calls to the U.K when we had actually made 4 calls. They charged us 66 Euros when we were on the phone for less than 15 minutes. When I gave the desk clerk 70 Euros to pay this he informed me that he had no change, he also said that if I had paid 5 Euros for a phone card I could have been on the phone for an hour. I think they were a bit late telling me this don't you?

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: MJC76
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nights for the price of 2 so good value. Perfect location, we walked to all major sights during our 3 days. The vatican was the sight most far away which was about 45 min away. But if you intend to walk this much good shoes are advisable. Close to shopping and restaurants. Nice room but a rather noisy AC. Otherwise quit room. OK breakfast but not very well organised as you may have to wait for a while to get a table if you go down when the big rush is at about 9 am. Did shopping in the morning and then went to all the big sights in the afternoon when queues were less. We went to the vatican and the 16th chapel at around 2.30 pm and just walked right in, no queue. Heard that in the morning it can be a 2 hours queue.

Reviews.Title: “Not so jolly at the Giolli”
Reviews.Author: etc90
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! I don't know how this hotel aquired the 3 Stars given it because it was one of the least pleasant places I have ever stayed! The very first day my watch was stolen from my room - most likely because I did not tip the housekeeper who showed me how to turn on the air conditioner. We arrived early and the room was ready, took a shower, and headed out; halfway down the block I realized I had left my watch on the sink counter and when we came back, it was "gone." I am positive that it was taken by the maid. Additionally, the air conditioner was ineffective and the room, although clean, was dingy and depressing due to poor lighting, and a broken (literally, hanging off the wall) lamp that was not fixed for the entire duration of our stay - 8 nights! Breakfast was typical of Italy, however, sometimes we were charged for capaccino and sometimes we were not. I requested an additional room key and was told I could only receive one key because they were unique, however, other guests (though, not all) did receive duplicate keys. Most of the staff could be considered curt, with the exception of Carlo who (as I read on this site) was pleasant, helpful and genuine. The only thing really great about this hotel is the location, but there are at least 10-15 hotels on this strip ranging from elegant to fair and there are plenty of choices. The hotel really had a negative effect on what I had hoped to be a relaxing and enjoyable vacation! I advise that you look around and take this place only as a last resort. Also, after realizing that I was dissatisfied with the place and that there were other (more pleasant) options along the same strip I was denied a refund (even a half refund) and was literally forced to stay somewhere that I was very unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Great Location. Very Clean. Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: TroubleNYC
Reviews.Content: This is a typical european hotel located on the second floor of a nice building in the center of Roma. We were able to acquire this last minute as our plans had changed and we arrived to Roma a day early. I would highly recommend the Triple Rooms overlooking Via Natzionale because they are simply enormous. If you stay in the front rooms you will hear some traffic but if you live in NYC as I do, it wasnt a problem at all. Our second night they were able to find room for us in a double, which is in the back, very quiet, but a little on the small side. However, for 120 EU a night, you can't beat it. OK, so that room was a little small, the plus is that its very clean, the staff is extremely friendly, helpful, accomodating, and the location is great. We just loved this neighborhood because its close to most of the main destinations. Trevi Fountain, the Colloseum, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Termini Station *but not close enough to the station to deal with the riff raff*.... Also, great water pressure, you've got a mini fridge that is not expensive and air conditioning, an elevator, your own private bath.... I mention these things because not all places has them. This is not the W Hotel but it is a true european old style hotel and we just loved it. Not an easy thing to do, we are pretty picky people.

Reviews.Title: “Great for tourists”
Reviews.Author: candlesticks
Reviews.Content: All in all a good hotel. A Great location easy walk from trevi fountain. Bus stop across the street (very convenient) as well as a tourist information booth, who were more helpful than the hotel staff. (although Romans in general aren't that helpful... do your homework) Hotel service was not great... unless you spoke Italian.. then it probably was great (we didn't speak Italian... but it was fairly obvious when you asked a question in English they provided the least possible information). As for the room and bathroom they were fine... bed had clean sheets... bathroom was a good size and decently clean. (When I say good size I mean for american standards it was average, not crowded, no water all over the floor after a shower, it had a full size tub with a shower). For the room itself there was a bit of wallpaper pealing off the wall but the key things (tables, beds, sink, tub) were clean. The elevator isn't enormous, particularly problematic for huge bags... but not impossible. We had one large and one small bag and were fine, but there is only one elevator for the building so it can get busy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: tige1968
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome during the Wales v Italy RugbyGame, we found the hotel to be in a great location, large room, not too far from attractions, cafe bars, pubs nearby, hotel staff friendly, should I return to Rome I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great place for tourists!”
Reviews.Author: teewee81
Reviews.Content: my mother, 2 sisters and myself recently visited Rome for the 1st time. Hotel Giolli was located in an excellent location, very clean and the rooms were a nice size. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Room - Loved the Giolli!”
Reviews.Author: minnie819
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Giolli for 2 nights earlier this month, and it was just great. Fantastic location - right around the corner from several little cafe/bars & an internet cafe, and w/in walking distance of the Forum, the Coloseum, etc. Our room was enormous - granted we are NY'ers used to our tiny studio apartments but the place just felt HUGE to us! :) Nice hardwood floors, tons of storage space. The bathroom was lovely & clean as well, with nice fixtures. The only minuses I can think of were the faint smoke smell (it was a nonsmoking room), and if it had been summer and we wanted the window open we wouldn't have had that great of a view (window looked over an airshaft/courtyard). For the price, it was perfect. We didn't get to sample the free breakfast but the staff were all wonderful. I wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Is in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ellebel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giolli, The hotel is in a great location , on the 64 busroute and within easy walking distance of most sights. Carlo is the only friendly and very obliging person in the hotel as all the other staff give you the impression that you are a nuisance. Rooms are very clean but it depends on which room you get as to the size of it. room 238 was large but room 104 was tiny. Try and get a room on the front as they have a view as the others look out on an internal quadrant. Breakfast is acceptable but basic, eggs were cooked the night before. We were in a large party and would have liked to be able to have tea and coffee etc. in the lounge but that was only possible if Carlo was on and then it was a problem as he had to do other duties at the same time.. I would not go back to hotel Giolli as there are many more hotels for the same price in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hctils
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at the Giolli, we stayed 3 nights at the sister hotel Virgilio and the Giolli was by far the better of the two. When we arrived at the airport for our flight home we found it had been cancelled, we phoned Virgilio to ask could we stay another night but it was full but the receptionist found us a room at the Giolli. On arrival at this hotel after much stress we couldn't have been treated better are bags were carried to our room and the gentleman on the front desk was so apoligetic even though none of our problems were his fault. The hotel was very clean and secure and our room overlooked the Via Nazionale, you could hear a bit of traffic noise but with windows shut it was fine and I did like to look out the window and people watch. Overall would recommend this hotel and will be using it again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Giolli experience”
Reviews.Author: wearyfeet
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 3 nights in June 2006. Start with the very rude desk clerk that treated the customer's as if they were an inconvience. Upon arrival the elevator was broken. We were lied to about the readiness of our rooms. (They were ready). One of the two rooms air conditioners did not work. (Blamed on the hot weather). The water temperature in the showers fluctuated from very hot to ice cold and the rooms were small. One day we arrived for breakfast 10 minutes before closure, (yes we overslept that day but still in time for a croissant and coffee) and the girls turned the coffee urn spicketss away from us as we approached and quickly moved the croissants behind the counter. The final straw was after checking with the desk clerk the night before about calling a taxi for us in the morning, the next morning we were instructed to fetch one in the street as "they always come by". Needless to say we had to drag our suitcases to the train station as no taxi would stop. We just caught our train and will never go back to Hotel Giolli.

Reviews.Title: “clean, safe, great location”
Reviews.Author: capt_nutso
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed Hotel Giolli. Carlo welcomed us and provided much needed info on the city and it's people. The hotel was clean. The rooms are small by American standards, but most European hotel rooms are. It was still big enough for us - we weren't in Rome to spend time in our hotel room! The continental breakfast wasn't too great either, but again - it's par for the course. The hotels we stayed at in other Italian cities had very similar breakfasts. The best feature of the hotel is it's location. We walked to all the major sites in Rome from our hotel - the Colosseum, the forum, the Vatican, the Pantheon, the Trevi fountain,... it was great! Very close to Quarinale, Trevi, and Trajan's Market. I would highly recommend Hotel Giolli!

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: gpd132
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the price. At the last minute we needed a hotel in the center. We checked with Hotel Reservations (yellow sign with black writing) at the Rome Termini train station. They arranged a room for us for 80 euro. The room was a nice size and clean. Bathroom was clean. Good water pressure and lots of hot water. The AC/Heater was not working so well but was not an issue. It was cold out and the heat only came on and did not adjust by the dial. Also the shower head was not working so I used the euro style hand held shower which worked great. The TV was small but you will not use it in Rome. Breakfast was typical continental and good. The staff was very friendly and held our bags after checkout so we could walk around. Much of the staff were foreigners, mostly Russians I think, and that may account for what some reviews take as being rude. I think their enlgish is not so good so maybe that is why, but I found them to be polite. It is very close to everything and yes, its better to walk than to go by vehicle, traffic is terrible at all times. There was street noise always but the location and price and cleanliness of the hotel overcame all the low points. I would recommend it for a few nites and would go back for sure.
